sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
message_1:
Given two sets A = {1,2} and B = {2,3}, determine the following:

1. A x B (Cartesian product of A and B)
2. B x A (Cartesian product of B and A)
3. (A x B) U (B x A) (Union of the Cartesian products from parts 1 and 2)
4. (B x A) U (A x B) (Union of the Cartesian products from parts 2 and 1)

Show that the result of parts 3 and 4 are not equal, proving that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to union.
